org.nzdis.micro

Class AgentLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.nzdis.micro.AgentLoader

  • public class AgentLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a generic group-wise agent loader. One should use SystemAgentLoader for system-level agent instantiations. For local group-wise agent loading Group provides local AgentLoader.

    AgentLoader.java
    Created: Thu Mar 15 13:37:42 2001
    Version:
    $Revision: 2.0 $ $Date: 2011/06/14 00:00:00 $
    Author:
    Mariusz Nowostawski (Original author), Christopher Frantz (Revision author)

      • newAgent

        public AgentController newAgent(Role aRole)
        Instantiate an Agent for a given Role. This method will create an Agent object with the given role capability.
        Parameters:
        aRole - Role implementation to be played by the instantiated agent
        Returns:
        AgentController for newly created agent

      • newAgent

        public AgentController newAgent(Role aRole,
                                java.lang.String name,
                                boolean useNameAsPrefix)
        Variant of newAgent() with agent name as further parameter, and option to use the passed agent name parameter as prefix for the actual agent name which is then determined by the platform at runtime.
        Parameters:
        aRole - - Role to be instantiated
        name - - Agent name to be assigned to new agent (if useNameAsPrefix is false)
        useNameAsPrefix - - indicates that agent name will only be used as prefix, actual name (appended ID) will be determined by platform at runtime.
        Returns:

        Variant of newAgent() with role to be instantiated, agent name, indicator if agent name is only to be used as prefix (rest of name determined by platform) and a Clojure script holding the agent implementation
        Parameters:

        name -
        useNameAsPrefix -
        cljScript -

        public AgentController newAgent(Role[] aRoleArray,
                                java.lang.String name,
                                boolean useNameAsPrefix)
        Variant of newAgent() with role array and agent name as further parameter, and option to use the passed agent name parameter as prefix for the actual agent name which is then determined by the platform at runtime.
        Parameters:
        aRoleArray -
        name -
        useNameAsPrefix -
        Returns:

      • newAgent

        public AgentController newAgent(Role[] aRoleArray,
                                java.lang.String name,
                                boolean useNameAsPrefix,
                                java.lang.String cljScript)
        Variant of newAgent() with role array to be instantiated on new agent with specified agent name. Optionally the passed agent name parameter can be used as prefix for the actual agent name (useNameAsPrefix true) which is then determined by the platform at runtime. Additionally a Clojure script for the agent implementation can be passed.
        Parameters:
        aRoleArray -
        name -
        useNameAsPrefix -
        cljScript -
        Returns:

      • newAgent

        public Agent newAgent(java.lang.Class anAgentClass)
        Instantiate an Agent for a given Agent class. This method will create an Agent instance directly via the default agent constructor.
        Parameters:
        anAgentClass - Class of the agent to be instantiated
        Returns:
        newly created agent instance or null if the agent cannot be instantiated

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        agent instance

      • findAgentsByRoles

        public Agent[] findAgentsByRoles(java.lang.Class aRoleType,
                                 boolean includeGroupOwnerInSearch)
        Finds all working agents for a given role type recursively throughout all sub-groups.
        Parameters:
        aRoleType - - Class of the role to be found
        includeGroupOwnerInSearch - indicates if group owner is to be included in lookup
        Returns:
        - array of agents which play the exact type or subtypes of a specified role type

      • findAgentNamesByRoles

        public java.lang.String[] findAgentNamesByRoles(java.lang.Class aRoleType,
                                                boolean includeGroupOwnerInSearch)
        Finds all working agents' names for a given role type recursively throughout all sub-groups.
        Parameters:
        aRoleType - - Class of the role to be found
        includeGroupOwnerInSearch - indicates if group owner is to be included in lookup
        Returns:
        - array of agents' names who play of the exact type or subtypes of a specified role type

      • findRoles

        public Role[] findRoles(java.lang.Class aRoleType,
                        boolean includeGroupOwnerInSearch)
        Finds all working roles for a given role type recursively throughout all sub-groups.
        Parameters:
        aRoleType - - Class of the role to be found
        includeGroupOwnerInSearch - indicates if group owner is to be included in lookup
        Returns:
        - array of roles which are of the exact type or subtypes of a specified role type

      • findRolesByIntent

        public Role[] findRolesByIntent(java.lang.Class<Intent> intentType,
                                boolean includeGroupOwnerInSearch)
        Finds all working roles for a given intent type recursively throughout all sub-groups.
        Parameters:
        intentType - - Intent type to be looked up.
        includeGroupOwnerInSearch - indicates if group owner is to be included in lookup
        Returns:
        - array of roles which can process the intent

      • findAgentsByIntent

        public Agent[] findAgentsByIntent(java.lang.Class<Intent> intentType,
                                  boolean includeGroupOwnerInSearch)
        Finds all existing Agents for a given intent type recursively throughout all sub-groups.
        Parameters:
        intentType - - Class for the intents to be found
        includeGroupOwnerInSearch - indicates if group owner is to be included in lookup
        Returns:
        array of Agents providing roles for a specified intent type
